Registration Sensor Multi-purpose Tray Paper Sensor Fixing Delivery Sensor Delivery Sensor Duplex Re-pickup Sensor SR1 SR6 SR3 SR4 SR22
Error in temperature rising of Fixing Assembly
Temperature of the Fixing Assembly did not reach certain temperature within the specified period of time.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal high temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Main Thermistor) was abnormally high.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal low temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Main Thermistor) was abnormally low.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in fixing power supply drive circuit
The zero cross signal was not detected for the specified period of time or longer.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Main Thermistor (TH802). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 4. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of Main Motor
The revolution of the Fixing Motor did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Main Motor (M701) and the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Main Motor (M701). 4. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The revolution of the Main Motor was out of the specified range.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Main Motor (M701) and the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Main Motor (M701). 4. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error was detected in the Main Motor.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Main Motor (M701) and the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Main Motor (M701). 4. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in the Color Displacement/Density Sensor was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the RD Sensor (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the RD Sensor (UN3). 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The connection of the Duplex Feed Unit was not correct.
An error in the Environment Sensor was detected.
1. Check the harness/connectors between the Environment Sensor (UN10) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Environment Sensor (UN10). 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in the Scanner Motor, the Laser Unit, or the BD detection was detected in the yellow scanner area.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in the Scanner Motor, the Laser Unit, or the BD detection was detected in the magenta scanner area.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in the Scanner Motor, the Laser Unit, or the BD detection was detected in the cyan scanner area.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in the Scanner Motor, the Laser Unit, or the BD detection was detected in the black scanner area.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The error is detected when the completion of pseudo BD measurement is not notified within the specified period of time after the pseudo BD generation.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The update of the DC Controller failed.
1. Install the set of controller firmware. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in writing/reading of main program in the Main Controller PCB (Main ROM).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
ROM writing/reading error (ROM for storing setting values)
Error in writing/reading of the setting values storage area in the Main Controller PCB (ROM for storing setting values).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Unable to read/write data from the eMMC. The eMMC failure occurred.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
The eMMC has been replaced wrongly. The eMMC failure occurred.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
An error in the nonvolatile memory on the Engine Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power and check if the symptom occurs again. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The CIS Unit could not detect the home position when starting a scanning operation.

1. Check the harness/connector connecting from the Main Controller PCB (UN30) to the CIS HP Sensor (SR11) and the Reader Motor (M5). 2. Replace the CIS HP Sensor (SR11). 3. Replace the Reader Motor (M5). 4. Replace the CIS Unit. 5. Replace the Reader Unit. 6. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
The CIS Unit could not detect the home position when completing a scanning operation.

1. Check the harness/connector connecting from the Main Controller PCB (UN30) to the CIS HP Sensor (SR11) and the Reader Motor (M5). 2. Replace the CIS HP Sensor (SR11). 3. Replace the Reader Motor (M5). 4. Replace the CIS Unit. 5. Replace the Reader Unit. 6. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Light intensity of the CIS Unit below the reference level
When the light intensity is below the reference level at shading.
1. Disconnect and then connect the Flexible Cable. 2. Replace the Flexible Cable. 3. Replace the CIS Unit. 4. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in access to backup data for the Reader (reading error at power-on)
The Reader-related adjustment values could not be read.
1. Install the set of controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in communication with new Card Reader (serial communication)
Unable to communicate with the new Card Reader.
1. Check the connection of the new Card Reader.
1. Install the set of controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
A communication error between the Engine Controller PCB and the Main Controller PCB occurred.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 2. Install the set of controller firmware. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
1. Check the connection of the NCU PCB (UN38). 2. Replace the NCU PCB (UN38). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in ROM for backing up fax data
An error occurred in the ROM for backing up fax data.
1. Check the connection of the NCU PCB (UN38). 2. Replace the NCU PCB (UN38). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power.
Invalid combination of language file versions
The language file version did not match that of the main program.
The size of the language file exceeded the allowed size.
Version mismatch between BOOTABLE and BOOTROM
A version mismatch between the main program and the start-up program.
It was detected that an invalid engine was connected.
1. Check whether a proper Engine Controller PCB (UN1) is installed. 2. Update the firmware. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Communication error between Control Panel PCB and Main Controller PCB
Communication with the Control Panel PCB could not be established.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Panel PCB (UN31) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 2. Replace the Control Panel (including the Panel PCB (UN31)). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Communication error with Wireless LAN PCB
Communication with the Wireless LAN PCB could not be established.

1. Turn OFF and then ON the main power. 2. Check the harness/connector between the Wireless LAN PCB (UN35) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 3. Install the set of controller firmware. 4. Replace the Wireless LAN PCB (UN35). 5. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
An error in the microcomputer that retains fax job information of the Main Controller PCB.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
A communication error with the Main Controller PCB occurred (other than scan-related communication error).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Information on digital registration could not be obtained.
1. Install the Engine Controller firmware. 2. Install the set of controller firmware. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the power state of the Laser Scanner Unit (firmware-dependent).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit.
The Main Fan fails to rotate at the specified rotation speed.
1. Check the connection of the Main Fan (FM1). 2. Replace the Main Fan (FM1).
An error in the pressure release mechanism of the Fixing Assembly was detected.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Pressure Release Switch (SW2) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Motor (M702) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Fixing Motor (M702). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly (including the Fixing Pressure Release Switch (SW2)). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
